negotiation_message: Alice said in round 1: Hi oliver! To start, I propose that I take the book and two hats, and you take one hat and the ball. This gives us each a variety of items. What do you think of this division? Let me know if you have any other suggestions.
oliver replied in round 1: How about you take all 3 hats, while I get 1 book and 1 ball?

Alice said in round 2: Thanks for the counteroffer oliver. The issue with your proposal is that it would leave me with only hats, while you get a more balanced set of items. I'd prefer a division that gives us each a mix of different items.

What if we modify my original offer slightly - I take the book and 1 hat, and you take 2 hats and the ball? This way we each end up with multiple types of items. Let me know your thoughts on this!
oliver replied in round 2: yes that sounds good. deal

Alice said in round 3: Wonderful, I'm glad we were able to come to an agreement that we both find acceptable! To summarize, I will take the book and 1 hat, and you will take the 2 remaining hats and the ball. 

I believe this is a fair and balanced deal. We each end up with a mix of different item types, and the quantities seem equitable as well. Let me know if you concur that this is our final agreement.

If so, then I propose we halt the negotiation here. It was a pleasure negotiating with you oliver!
oliver replied in round 3: halt negotiation
